attributes.action: do all he can to bring about an early improvement in UK-Libya relations, once the Foreign and Commonwealth Office has advised the Queen to extend a State Visit invitation to Libyan head of state, Muammar al-Gaddafi.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Five years ago, Libya formally renounced terrorism and paid more than £1.5 billion in compensation related to actions for which Libyan officials were held responsible. Now reintegrated into the international community, Libya is currently one of 15 member states serving on the United Nations Security Council.

Although UK–Libya diplomatic relations are fully re-established after a 20-year break, economic relations with Libya have not yet improved to the same extent as that of our main exporting competitors (eg France). A State Visit by Muammar al-Gaddafi can be expected to redress this imbalance.

Having made protocol arrangements for inward State Visits in the 1970s, the Petition Creator (commissioned by the Queen on 5 August 1983 as an Officer of HM Diplomatic Service) would be pleased to assist the FCO in ensuring the success of a Libya State Visit.
